column4: any reason why burning an image always produces unreadable CDs while same image works fine when burnt with win-nero? I tried k3b, nerolinux, etc.
what are you using to burn the image?
well try to mount the burned cd
the final verification fails in both cases with read errors and the cd (kubuntu) is unbootable
no try to mount the cd
not to boot it, maybe the image is being burned as a file to the cd instead of being expanded or whatever the correct terminology is
you can try in a console typing 'cdrecord cdrom.img' that should burn it properly

ok, I'll sacrifice my last CD to try the cdrecord trick. By the way: the cd is written correctly. To be more precise, it boots but when I choose "Install" from the menu it fails because of reading errors.
you should md5 check the cd image then
the image is probably messed up
I already verified it. the same file works well when burnt with nero for windwos
cdrecord tells me "Error: Cannot gain SYS_RAWIO capability.Is cdrecord installed SUID root?" but burns nevertheless
ok then I doubt you will have any different results, because k3b is just a frontend to command line programs: cdrecord, cdrdao etc.
I read somewhere that TAO mode could cause some problems with certain drives.
